law.catch_line: Criminal mischief in the third degree.

text.section:
A person is guilty of criminal mischief in the third degree when:
Having no right to do so or any reasonable ground to believe that he has such right, he intentionally or wantonly defaces, destroys or damages any property; or
He tampers with property so as knowingly to endanger the person or property of another.
Criminal mischief in the third degree is a Class B misdemeanor.

law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 183, sec. 4, effective June 19, 1976. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 108, effective January 1, 1975.
